properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: This afternoon and evening, conditions will be favourable to the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots, frequent lightning and poor to very poor visibilities due to thunderstorms, strong at times. ### Proceed with caution as visibility may suddenly be reduced to near zero. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2019-08-18T05:59:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-17T15:26:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2694686198.2019
Area: Lake Memphrémagog - northern half, Richelieu River and Northern Lake Champlain
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: This afternoon and evening, conditions will be favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts and heavy rain. Boaters may be surprised by strong gusts over bodies of water. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-18T03:24:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-17T15:25:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3774587599.2019
Area: Saint-Rémi area, Valleyfield - Beauharnois area, Hemmingford area, Huntingdon area, Sorel - Yamaska area, Saint-Hyacinthe - Acton Vale area, Verchères - Beloeil area, Saint-Jean - Marieville area, Lacolle area, Bécancour - Villeroy area, Victoriaville area, Nicolet area, Drummondville area, Granby - Waterloo area, Brome-Missisquoi area, Richmond area, Weedon area, Thetford Mines area, Mont-Orford - Lake Memphrémagog area, Sherbrooke area, Coaticook area, Lac-Mégantic area, Cookshire area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog this morning. Locally dense fog has developed early this morning near the north shore of Lake Superior. This dense fog will persist for a few hours this morning before lifting. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-17T20:00:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-17T10:06:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4259566109.2019
Area: City of Thunder Bay, Cloud Bay - Dorion, Nipigon - Rossport, Marathon - Schreiber
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Under partly cloudy skies, patchy frost is expected tonight. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-17T23:03:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-17T07:04:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0334395479.2019

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long period of snowfall with total amounts of 20 to 30 cm is expected. Early- season heavy snow for part of the Alaska Highway. An unseasonably cold arctic airmass will descend upon northern BC beginning late today. Rain forecast over the region today will change over to snow at times heavy this evening as temperatures quickly approach the freezing mark. Significant snowfall accumulations of 20 cm or more are anticipated overnight through Sunday at higher elevations of the Alaska Highway between Fort Nelson and Watson Lake and to the south of Fort Nelson. Significant snowfall accumulations are not expected in Fort Nelson because any snow that does fall will be too wet. The heavy snow is forecast to end by Monday morning. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Heavy snowfall accumulation may cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-18T03:29:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-17T11:30:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1925228146.2019
Area: Fort Nelson
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. A low pressure system continues to bring heavy rain to parts of northwestern Saskatchewan. In total, rainfall amounts of 40 to 60 mm are expected, with locally higher amounts up to 90 mm possible. Periods of rain are expected to linger across northern Saskatchewan until Sunday morning. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-18T02:18:48-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-17T10:19:48-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2211384447.2019
Area: Cluff Lake Mine, La Loche and Clearwater River Prov. Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. In total, rainfall amounts of 50 to 75 mm are expected. In the last 24 hours, Key Lake has reported near 30 mm of rain and Collins Bay has reported 43 mm. These regions are forecast to get another 15 to 30 mm by Sunday. As well, stations in the La Loche region have reported up to 49 mm of rain with a further 5 mm expected today. Periods of rain are expected to linger across northern Saskatchewan through Sunday. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-18T05:47:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-17T13:48:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4020338480.2019
Area: Cluff Lake Mine, La Loche and Clearwater River Prov. Park, Cree Lake - Key Lake, Wollaston Lake - Collins Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

An unseasonably cold arctic airmass will descend upon northern BC beginning late today. Rain forecast over the region today will change over to snow at times heavy this evening as temperatures quickly approach the freezing mark. Significant snowfall accumulations of 20 cm or more are anticipated overnight through Sunday at higher elevations of the Alaska Highway between Fort Nelson and Watson Lake and to the south of Fort Nelson.
